div.p: RAMSAY, ROBERT (1842-1882), Australian statesman, was native of Hawick, Roxburghshire, but his parents emigrated t Victoria when he was a child of four, and he was educated at th Scottish college in Melbourne. He studied law at Melbourn University, and subsequently became a member of a w T ell-know firm of solicitors in the city. He married in 1868 Isabel] Catherine Urquhart, and in 1870 entered the assembly for Ea: Bourke in the Conservative and free trade interest. He was member of the government of James Goodall Francis in 1872 74.
